snippet: “As a former Swedish Army soldier and veteran myself, I found it strange that a U.S. Army officer and a pioneer military aviator of World War I had been forgotten,” said Johan Kinberg.
abstract: Johan Kinberg tells of his two-year quest to bring recognition to American World War I veteran who had been buried at Woodlawn Cemetery in the Bronx for 91 years without marker; search began after Kinberg came across old newspaper article about death of Capt George J Kinberg, while researching his family tree.
lead_paragraph: “As a former Swedish Army soldier and veteran myself, I found it strange that a U.S. Army officer and a pioneer military aviator of World War I had been forgotten,” said Johan Kinberg.

headline.main: Quest to Honor a Veteran Spans Years and Continents
headline.print_headline: Quest to Honor a Veteran Spans Years and Continents
